Wisdom: أَفِقْ أَيُّهَا السَّامِعُ [النَّاسِي‏] مِنْ سَكْرَتِكَ وَاسْتَيْقِظْ مِنْ غَفْلَتِكَ وَاحْتَصِرْ [اخْتَصِرْ] مِنْ عَجَلَتِكَ
enWisdom: Recover, O listener, from your stupor, and wake up from your heedlessness, and curb (or cut short) your haste [towards sins]

Wisdom: أَلَا مُسْتَيْقِظٌ مِنْ غَفْلَتِهِ قَبْلَ نَفَادِ مُدَّتِهِ
enWisdom: Is there nobody who will wake up from his [slumber of] negligence before his time [on this earth] ends?
One who remembers death forgets his aspirations

Wisdom: وَيْلٌ لِمَنْ غَلَبَتْ عَلَيْهِ الْغَفْلَةُ فَنَسِيَ الرِّحْلَةَ وَلَمْ يَسْتَعِدَّ
enWisdom: Woe be to the one who is overcome by negligence so he forgets his [final] journey and does nor prepare for it

Wisdom: اذْكُرُوا مُفَرِّقَ الْجَمَاعَاتِ وَمُبَاعِدَ الْأُمْنِيَّاتِ وَمُدْنِيَ الْمَنِيَّاتِ [المسنيات‏] وَالْمُؤْذِنَ بِالْبَيْنِ وَالشَّتَاتِ
enWisdom: Remember the disperser of gatherings, the dasher of hopes, the bringer of death[s] and the announcer of disunion and separation
